content:
I am an undergraduate bioengineering student at the University of Engineering and Technology (UTEC) in Lima, Peru. My research interests lie in the applications of micro/nanotechnology in medicine and biological research, including biomaterials, nanobiosensors, microfluidics and bioMEMS.
I completed a remote research internship at the Electron Microscopy Facility of the Birck Nanotechnology Center at Purdue University. I worked on the microfabrication of structures with a Focused Ion Beam (FIB) - Scanning Electron Microscope (SEM) dual beam system.
Download my curriculum.
summary: I am an undergraduate bioengineering student at the University of Engineering and Technology (UTEC) in Lima, Peru. My research interests lie in the applications of micro/nanotechnology in medicine and biological research, including biomaterials, nanobiosensors, microfluidics and bioMEMS.
title: Jairo Narro

content: We proposed an injectable collagen-chitosan hydrogel loaded with hiPSC-CMs for myocardium regeneration. In adittion, we proposed a phase I clinical trial to test the safety and effectiveness of the product. We define the inclusion and exclusion criteria for patient selection, and the methods and techniques for monitoring the outcome measures. For more information about the project, please refer to the ‚ÄòPDF‚Äô button above.
summary: We proposed an injectable collagen-chitosan hydrogel loaded with hiPSC-CMs for myocardium regeneration. In adittion, we proposed a phase I clinical trial to test the safety and effectiveness of the product. We define the inclusion and exclusion criteria for patient selection, and the methods and techniques for monitoring the outcome measures.
title: Injectable Collagen-Chitosan Hydrogel loaded with Human Induced Pluripotent Stem-Cells for Myocardial Regeneration

content: For the Cleveland Clinic - UTEC Challenge 2022, we proposed the design of a microfluidic sensor that integrates the CRISPR/Cas13 system for the diagnosis of infectious diseases. The microfluidic device consists of three modules: RNA extraction (1), RNA elution (2) and CRISPR reaction (3). If the pathogen is present, the cas13 collateral cleavage function will be activated, and the reporters will release a fluorescent signal that can be measured with a mobile app. This low-cost and easy-to-handle diagnostic platform can be implemented in remote areas with medical centers that do not have adequate infrastructure or equipment.
summary: For the Cleveland Clinic - UTEC Challenge 2022, we proposed the design of a microfluidic sensor that integrates the CRISPR/Cas13 system for the diagnosis of infectious diseases. The microfluidic device consists of three modules: RNA extraction (1), RNA elution (2) and CRISPR reaction (3).
title: CRISPR-based Microfluidic Biosensor

content: Droplet formation is an important process for different types of biological analysis. In this work, a water-in-oil droplet-generating microfluidic device was designed, fabricated and tested. The microfluidic chip was fabricated by stereolithography 3D printing and its performance was evaluated using syringe pumps. For more information about the project, please refer to the ‚ÄòPDF‚Äô button above.
summary: Droplet formation is an important process for different types of biological analysis. In this work, a water-in-oil droplet-generating microfluidic device was designed, fabricated and tested. The microfluidic chip was fabricated by stereolithography 3D printing and its performance was evaluated using syringe pumps.
title: 3D Printed Microfluidic Device

summary: Focused ion beam (FIB) bitmap milling is a technique used for the fabrication of micro- and nanostructures with high precision. Bitmap files can store the design information of a structure and control the beam dwell time in each pixel. We developed a Graphical User Interface that enables fast and automatic generation of patterns and bitmap files for 2D and 3D micro-structures fabrication with a FIB. Currently, this Python-based tool can generate bitmap files for arrays of different geometries, including circles, squares, and triangles. In addition, the interface can generate a suitable grayscale for 3D structures by defining the profile function.
title: A New Tool for Automation of Focused Ion Beam Bitmap Milling of Two-and Three-Dimensional Micro and Nanostructures

content: This project was part of a Biomaterials course. We proposed a liposome-based drug delivery system for the treatment of rheumatoid arthritis, aiming to increase the half-life of the drug, promote drug accumulation in the joints and reduce its systemic effect. For more information click on the ‚ÄòPDF‚Äô button above.
summary: This project was part of a Biomaterials course. We proposed a liposome-based drug delivery system for the treatment of rheumatoid arthritis, aiming to increase the half-life of the drug, promote drug accumulation in the joints and reduce its systemic effect.
title: Polyethylene glycol (PEG) liposomes with folate for the delivery of methotrexate via intra-articular injection for the treatment of rheumatoid arthritis.

content: In this project, the biological processes (BP) and molecular functions (MF) involved in pancreatic cancer and diabetes (type 1 and 2) were compared by GO annotations. Enrichment analysis was performed on a set of differentially expressed genes using R packages. Data sets belonging to three different studies were obtained from the NCBI GEO database, and all samples were collected from peripheral blood mononuclear cells. Relevant BPs and MFs were identified for each pathology individually. No related GO terms were found between type 1 diabetes and cancer. However, two significant GO terms were found between type 2 diabetes and cancer related to positive transcriptional regulation. In addition, lipopolysaccharide response and eicosanoid biosynthesis were identified as biological processes in type 2 diabetes that are related to the development of pancreatic cancer.
summary: In this project, the biological processes (BP) and molecular functions (MF) involved in pancreatic cancer and diabetes (type 1 and 2) were compared by GO annotations. Enrichment analysis was performed on a set of differentially expressed genes using R packages.
title: Enrichment Analysis in R

content: We present a graphical user interface developed in Python that facilitates the generation of bitmap files for the fabrication of patterns and arrays of different geometries with a Focused Ion Beam (FIB) taking into account different milling parameters. For 3D structures, a suitable grayscale can be generated depending on the profile function defined. A second window will show the cross-section view of the structure. The patterns generated with the interface can be saved as a 24-bit bitmap file and then imported into the FIB system.
summary: We present a graphical user interface developed in Python that facilitates the generation of bitmap files for the fabrication of patterns and arrays of different geometries with a Focused Ion Beam (FIB) taking into account different milling parameters.
title: Focused Ion Beam Bitmap File Generator

content: We do a lot of needful activities with computers. Unfortunately, not everyone can use a computer. Due to accidents, infections, or diseases, people can suffer the amputation of both upper limbs. Therefore, we designed aUto_JD, a joystick-operated computer mouse that will allow people with bilateral upper extremity amputations to use a computer properly. With aUtoJD, we hope believe computer interactions such as surfing the Internet, playing video games, typing documents, chatting with friends, and many more activities are highly achievable for people with amputations.
summary: We do a lot of needful activities with computers. Unfortunately, not everyone can use a computer. Due to accidents, infections, or diseases, people can suffer the amputation of both upper limbs.
title: Joystick-operated computer mouse

content: Idiopathic Parkinson‚Äôs disease (IDP) is the second most common neurodegenerative disorder worldwide. Due to the non-existence of a cure, current treatments only focus on improving the quality of life by trying to slow the progression of the disease. Therefore, patients require constant monitoring and continuous visits to clinics. Because of this, it is necessary to identify biological markers that allow not only early diagnosis of the disease but also telemonitoring of patients. Different parameters of vocal signals can be used as potential markers for monitoring Parkinson‚Äôs disease. In this article, we present the results of the application of a Machine Learning model for the selection of relevant voice parameters to monitor a patient with IPD. We used a database containing 195 voice records from healthy individuals and IPD patients. The classification model that obtained the best result was k-nearest neighbors, with an accuracy of 97.8%. We also identified the HNR, RPDE, and DFA attributes as potential voice parameters for patient diagnosis and monitoring.
summary: Idiopathic Parkinson‚Äôs disease (IDP) is the second most common neurodegenerative disorder worldwide. Due to the non-existence of a cure, current treatments only focus on improving the quality of life by trying to slow the progression of the disease.
title: Machine Learning for Parkinson Disease

content: In this project, electroencephalogram (EEG) signals of 4 test subjects were analyzed. The data was obtained from the paper by Keirn (1990). The objective was to study and identify differences in EEG signals when subjects perform two different cognitive processes. The Time/Frequency Sub-regions of Interest (TFROI) and the Average Time-Frequency energy within that TFROI (TFROI-AVG) were used for the analysis. The cognitive tasks studied were Baseline and Multiplication. All analyses were performed using algorithms developed in MATLAB.
summary: In this project, electroencephalogram (EEG) signals of 4 test subjects were analyzed. The data was obtained from the paper by Keirn (1990). The objective was to study and identify differences in EEG signals when subjects perform two different cognitive processes.
title: EEG Signal Analysis in MATLAB

Overview The Wowchemy website builder for Hugo, along with its starter templates, is designed for professional creators, educators, and teams/organizations - although it can be used to create any kind of site The template can be modified and customised to suit your needs. It‚Äôs a good platform for anyone looking to take control of their data and online identity whilst having the convenience to start off with a no-code solution (write in Markdown and customize with YAML parameters) and having flexibility to later add even deeper personalization with HTML and CSS You can work with all your favourite tools and apps with hundreds of plugins and integrations to speed up your workflows, interact with your readers, and much more The template is mobile first with a responsive design to ensure that your site looks stunning on every device. Create content in Markdown, Jupyter, or RStudio Plugin System - Fully customizable color and font themes Display Code and Math - Code highlighting and LaTeX math supported Integrations - Google Analytics, Disqus commenting, Maps, Contact Forms, and more! No databases. Only files. Themes Wowchemy and its templates come with automatic day (light) and night (dark) mode built-in. Alternatively, visitors can choose their preferred mode - click the moon icon in the top right of the Demo to see it in action! Day/night mode can also be disabled by the site admin in params.toml.

summary: Welcome üëã We know that first impressions are important, so we've populated your new site with some initial content to help you get familiar with everything in no time.
title: Welcome to Wowchemy, the website builder for Hugo

content: In this project, I designed a CAD model in Onshape of a microfluidic droplet-generating device based on the article ‚ÄúHigh-throughput detection of ethanol-producing-cyanobacteria in a microdroplet platform‚Äù. The objective of the paper was to develop a quantitative ethanol detection method on a microdroplet-based platform to detect cyanobacterial strains and identify those with the highest levels of ethanol productivity.
summary: In this project, I designed a CAD model in Onshape of a microfluidic droplet-generating device based on the article ‚ÄúHigh-throughput detection of ethanol-producing-cyanobacteria in a microdroplet platform‚Äù. The objective of the paper was to develop a quantitative ethanol detection method on a microdroplet-based platform to detect cyanobacterial strains and identify those with the highest levels of ethanol productivity.
title: Microfluidic droplet-generator device
